jobDescription: The Role and TeamDataFox is the real-time source of truth on over 2 million companies around the world. Sales, marketing, and finance professionals all rely on DataFox to understand their markets and prioritize which companies they should be targeting.DataFox is looking for a data-driven, full-stack Senior Software Engineer who can take initiative and think creatively to build and maintain our enterprise product. You will work on our user experience from web application to API to Chrome Extension to integrations in order to extend DataFox’s leadership in automating the grunt work it takes to make business decisions.Here are some ways you'll make an impact: You’ll work as a team with PMs and Design to tackle open-ended UX problems and delight our customers.You'll tackle difficult technical challenges such as searching across terabytes of disjoint, unstructured data in an intuitive interfaceYou will instrument user analytics and make data-driven decisions about our featuresYou will jump on customer calls with Customer Success and Sales to gain empathy for our customers and see how your projects are used.You'll be a mentor and source of learning for less-experienced engineers - though you'll also continue to learn from everyone else.You'll do dev ops: engineers deploy and maintain production code!You've gained experience in (or are excited to learn!) tools and languages such as NodeJS, Python, SpaCy, Solr, Airflow, Redis, and Ansible.Are you our next Fox? You've gained at least 5+ years work experience as a professional software engineer.You write clean, modular code that is performant and secure.You have experience with a modern web stack (such as Rails, Django, MEAN, LAMP).You have experience on a modern frontend framework like React, Ember, Vue or Angular.You have built and maintained complex user interfaces.You have designed database schemas for scale.You take risks and move fast!You balance using existing approaches with new solutions to find the right tool for the job.Bonus Points:
